definition: to hold a teaching position
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
religion/teaching/to make/to cause/to tell
surname Jiao
to teach

sentences.english: Later he left Simin Martial Arts Institution and was invited to Shenshahai Sports School as a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 後從四民武術研究社被邀請到什剎海體校任教。

sentences.english: He once was employed as a country school-teacher.
She teaches in a state university.
sentences.chinese: 她在一所州立大學任教。

sentences.english: Since 1937, he had been teaching in The South-Western United University in Kunming.
sentences.chinese: 1937年抗戰開始，他在昆明西南聯大任教。

sentences.english: He dreams of the teaching job at Kabul University and of marrying a woman back home. She is the daughter of family friends a Sayed Shiite who traces her lineage to the prophet Muhammad.
sentences.chinese: 他夢想着在喀布爾大學任教，然後回老家娶媳婦。

sentences.english: After graduation, he was appointed as a teacher in Beijing Normal University in 1981.
sentences.chinese: 1981年畢業後何教授來到北師大任教。

sentences.english: Wang Li's father have taught English here since his graduation from Peking University.
sentences.chinese: 王立的父親從北大畢業後就一直在這任教。

sentences.english: Her coach at that time was Liao Zhixiong from Mingchuan University.
sentences.chinese: 教練是任教於銘傳大學的廖智雄先生。

sentences.english: She has also taught at the Ecole des Hautes Etudes en Sciences Sociales in Paris.
sentences.chinese: 她還在巴黎高等社會科學研究學校任教過。

sentences.english: It was my good fortune to teach in the Overseas Training Department of Shang- hai International Studies University (SISU).
sentences.chinese: 我有幸在上海外國語大學海外培訓部任教。

sentences.english: She teaches at Harvard's Department of Linguistics.
sentences.chinese: 她在哈佛大學語言學系任教授。

sentences.english: Li Shutong teaches at the Normal College of Zhejiang, with Feng Zikai as one of his students.
sentences.chinese: 李叔同任教於浙江兩級師範學堂，學生中包括豐子愷。

sentences.english: Professor Baglioni taught medicine at the university.
sentences.chinese: 巴格里奧尼教授任教於大學醫學院。

sentences.english: University of Science and Technology. Taught at University of Michigan.
sentences.chinese: 於香港科技大學，曾任教於美國密執安大學。

sentences.english: U. S. education experts to teach long-term stay in China.
sentences.chinese: 美國教育專家任教，長期住在中國。

sentences.english: Yen taught at the Architecture Department of Tamkang University for eight years.
sentences.chinese: 並曾在淡江大學建築系任教八年。

definition: to teach (in a school)
to teach classes in addition to other duties/to hold several teaching jobs
to go to school
hired (for employment)/invited (e.g. to lecture)/engaged (for a task)/(in olden times) betrothal gift from the groom's family
to give classes/to work as a teacher
to hold an office or post
to pursue one's studies
department of foreign languages/modern languages (college department)
to join the faculty of one's alma mater upon graduation/to remain at school during vacation
to pass entrance exam/to enter college after a competitive exam
PhD degree (Doctor of Philosophy)/also abbr. to 博士學位|博士学位
pinyin: zhe2 xue2 bo2 shi4 xue2 wei4

definition: provost
to seek knowledge/to study/to attend college
graduation/to graduate/to finish school
to major (in a field)/to study a specialty to obtain a higher degree
normal university/teacher training college
